articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Treacherous Action Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Treacherous Action Blasted
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Recently the Lee Myung Bak group replaced the present president of the south Korean Red Cross by a new guy even before the expiry of the term of his office under the pretext of liquidating the remnants of the "pro-north leftist regime." 
					 A spokesman for the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society in a statement released Thursday in this regard branded this action as an unpardonable treacherous and anti-reunification action running counter to the desire of all the compatriots for reconciliation and unity of the nation and the basic spirit of the Red Cross advocating humanitarianism and neutrality. 
					
					 The statement went on: 
					
					Ryu Jong Ha nominated by traitor Lee as the president of the south Korean Red Cross is an ultra-rightist conservative who took an active part in shaping the treacherous "policy towards the north" and finds himself busy inciting confrontation with compatriots as a minion of the pro-U.S. conservative regime. 
					
					 In the past days Lee let pro-U.S. anti-reunification elements hold important posts in the "government" and these days he assigned ultra-rightist conservatives duties to handle humanitarian work though they are steeped in the distrust and bitterness towards compatriots to the marrow of their bones. These actions brought to light once again his intention to pursue the anti-DPRK and anti-reunification confrontational policy, persistently refusing to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 It is clear that it is impossible to expect any Red Cross undertaking between the north and the south and any discussion on the humanitarian problem as long as the man serving the Lee group in its anti-DPRK confrontational  moves remains the boss of the Red Cross of south Korea.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group will be held fully responsible for all the consequences to be caused by its action to the Red Cross undertakings between the north and the south in the future.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK FM and Russian FM Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK FM and Russian FM Held
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Talks between DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on a visit to Russia and Sergei Lavrov, Russian foreign minister, were held in Moscow on Oct. 15.
					 Present at the talks were the foreign minister and his party and Kim Yong Jae, DPRK ambassador to Russia, from the DPRK side and Russian Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Aleksei Borodavkin and other officials concerned from the Russian side.
					
					 At the talks both sides recalled that the two countries significantly marked the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties and exchanged views on the issue of boosting the DPRK-Russia friendly and cooperative relations and a series of international matters of mutual concern. 
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: 2009-2010 Plan for Exchange between DPRK and Russian Foreign Ministries Signed
articles.content:
2009-2010 Plan for Exchange between DPRK and Russian Foreign Ministries Signed
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- A 2009-2010 plan for exchange between the Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Russian Foreign Ministry was signed in Moscow on Oct. 15.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and his party on a visit to Russia and Kim Yong Jae, DPRK ambassador to Russia, from the DPRK side and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, Russian Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Aleksei Borodavkin and other officials concerned from the Russian side. 
					
					 The plan was inked by Pak Ui Chun and Sergei Lavrov.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets New Zealand Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets New Zealand Ambassador
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with New Zealand Ambassador to the DPRK Jane Coombs who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Polish Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Polish Foreign Ministry Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs led by its Vice-Minister Ryszard Schnepf at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.

articles.title: Polish Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Polish Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Roman Iwaszkiewicz, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, Thursday hosted a reception on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Republic of Poland.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries here.
					
					 On hand were the delegation of the Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs led by Vice-Minister Ryszard Schnepf, the Polish royal string quartet and staff members of the Polish embassy here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Polish Royal String Quartet Gives Performance in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Polish Royal String Quartet Gives Performance in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by the Polish royal string quartet at the music hall of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory Thursday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Poland.
					 The performance was appreciated by Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of culture and arts, teachers and students of art educational institutions.
					
					 Among the audience were Roman Iwaszkiewicz, Polish ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy, the delegation of the Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs led by Vice-Minister Ryszard Schnepf and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					The Polish instrumentalists presented C major of the string quartet by K. Szymanowski, song "Sorrow" by M. Karlowicz and D minor of string quartet by L. Rozycki with exquisite timbre, refined rendition and high artistry.

articles.title: 27th Yun I Sang Concert Closes
articles.content:
27th Yun I Sang Concert Closes
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The 27th Yun I Sang Concert was closed.
					 Its closing performance took place at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall on Friday.
					
					 It was appreciated by Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, officials concerned and creators and artistes in the field of culture and arts.
					
					 Among the audience were the widow of Yun I Sang and his daughter, a visiting group of the "Yun I Sang Peace Foundation" of south Korea headed by Director Sin Kye Ryun, overseas compatriots, Thomas Schafer, Germany ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The performance was given by the orchestra of the Yun I Sang Music Institute and a south Korean cellist conducting art activities overseas.
					
					 Performers played orchestra "Don't Advance Night of Pyongyang", Tchaikovsky's second and third movements of Serenade Op.48 for string music and a cello concerto composed by Yun with dexterous technical skills.

articles.title: People's Sports Contest Opens
articles.content:
People's Sports Contest Opens
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The 11th People's Sports Contest of the DPRK was opened with due ceremony at Kim Il Sung Stadium Friday.
					 The participants will compete in more than 30 events including football, basketball, volleyball, table tennis and track and field, divided into the sports group and the mass sports group in Pyongyang and other parts of the country.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and others, officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, sportspersons and working people.
					
					 Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the Cabinet, made a congratulatory speech to be followed by an opening address by Pak Hak Son, chairman of the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission.
					
					 At the end of the opening ceremony there took place a men's football match between the April 25 Sports Group and the Amnokgang Sports Group.

articles.title: Cambodian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Cambodian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Sek Chansangvar and staff members of the Cambodian embassy here did friendship work at the DPRK-Cambodia Friendship Paeksok Cooperative Farm in Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province, on Friday.
					 The guests helped farmers in rice harvesting after being briefed on the monument to the on-site guidance given by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 During break, they watched an art performance and sang songs and conversed with farmers.
					
					 Sek Chansangvar wished the Korean people greater success in the future under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, noting that Cambodia would make positive efforts to develop the friendly relations with the DPRK. 
					
					 Embassy officials handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Juche Idea Praised by British Figure
articles.content:
Juche Idea Praised by British Figure
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea who is on a visit to the DPRK, was interviewed by KCNA at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel on October 14.
					 The immortal Juche idea fathered by President Kim Il Sung serves as a great guiding idea in the era of independence, he said, and went on:
					
					 The birth of the Juche idea marked an event that brought about a revolutionary turn in developing the progressive idea of humanity and realizing the cause of independence.
					
					 The Juche idea serves as eternal guidelines which should be held fast to not only by the Korean people but the world progressive people in the revolution and construction.
					
					 The DPRK has won only victories as a powerful country defying the U.S.-led imperialists' moves to put it under their control because it has solved all the problems in an independent and creative way strictly guided by the Juche idea.
					
					 All the successes achieved in the DPRK are a striking manifestation of the great vitality of the Juche idea.
					
					 The Songun politics pursued by leader Kim Jong Il is a new political mode for firmly defending the destiny of the country and the nation and socialism and successfully realizing the human cause of independence in the world in which the high-handed policy of the U.S. imperialists prevails, he said, adding that the Korean people are dynamically advancing along the road of socialism and independence holding aloft the banner of Juche, the banner of Songun true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: More Information Added to Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
More Information Added to Korean Revolution Museum
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- On display at the Hall "Leader and Comrades-in-arms" of the Korean Revolution Museum are more  information about revolutionary comrades-in-arms always remembered by President Kim Il Sung and the revolutionary comrades-in-arms often recollected by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Information about at least 70 revolutionary comrades-in-arms has been added to the hall.
					
					 Among them are several revolutionary comrades-in-arms including Kang Yun Bom who was loyal to the President in the days of Changdok School, and Ho Hon and Kang Ryang Uk who remained faithful to him in the period of building a new country, and Ri Jong Ok and Kye Ung Sang who were his loyalists in the period of postwar rehabilitation and construction and the socialist construction and So Chol, Jon Mun Sop and Choe Yong Jin who remained loyal to him from the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle to the period of the socialist construction.
					
					 Among them is Zhou Baozhong who was Chinese revolutionary comrade-in-arms in the period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 On display there is information about many soldiers of Kim Jong Il including Kim Kwang Jin, Ri Jin Su, Kang Sok Sung, Sok Yun Gi, Kim Yu Phung (Paek Min), Om Kil Son, Ri Jong Mok, Jon In Chol, Yon Hyong Muk and Kim Yong Sun who remained loyal to the leader. 
					
					 The above-said information includes photos, works, propositions, autographs, revolutionary relics, gifts, photos of individuals, relics, clippings of newspapers, books and others.
					
					 The materials on display serve as historical evidence proving that the President and Kim Jong Il are peerlessly outstanding revolutionary comrades who led all the comrades to leave traces of a worthwhile life, always finding themselves among them, and all those who are presented in the hall were the revolutionary soldiers who knew what a revolution was like and devoted themselves to the struggle under the benevolent care of the peerlessly great men.

articles.title: New Books Added to Grand People's Study House
articles.content:
New Books Added to Grand People's Study House
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The Grand People's Study House has received more new books.
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent new books and CDs of nearly 100 kinds to the house in several installments in recent days alone.
					
					 Among them are books that help develop the nation's science and technology and officials and other working people, youth and students raise the level of their knowledge.
					
					 Books including "Science of Potato Breeding", "New Technology of Cultivating High-Yielding Maize," "Research and Technology of Modern Neuroscience", "Regeneration Biology and Recycling Medicine" and "Numerator Endocrinology" provide broad knowledge about agriculture, medicine and information science and technology. 
					
					 The new books added to the study house include book "First Twelve Months" helpful to bringing up babies well and the book "Land of Morning Calm" introducing the Korean history, geography and customs early in the 20th century. It also received photo albums introducing world famous flowers, shellfishes and butterflies and CDs dealing with physics and Nano technology, etc.

articles.title: Songun Revolutionary Cause with Its Origin in DIU
articles.content:
Songun Revolutionary Cause with Its Origin in DIU
Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Today the Korean people are significantly greeting the 82nd anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					President Kim Il Sung with an unswerving conviction that the enemy armed to the teeth could be defeated only by dint of arms formed the DIU on October 17, Juche 15 (1926) and thus declared an over-all war against Japanese and other imperialisms.
					
					The formation of the DIU was a historic declaration heralding a new start of the Korean revolution and marked the glorious origin of Songun revolutionary cause.
					
					The DIU was the first revolutionary vanguard organization of Korea which embodied President Kim Il Sung's Juche-based idea of attaching importance to arms.
					
					Its formation was not a simple anti-imperialist organization. It was the first step for the historic cause of applying the Juche-oriented idea of giving priority to arms, the revolutionary theory on arms to practice and the initial stage of the preparations for building revolutionary armed ranks.
					
					Along with the completion of the preparations for armed struggle which started from the DIU, the President set forth the line of armed struggle as the strategic line of the Korean revolution and founded the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army in April 1932. 
					
					The socialist idea upheld by the DIU became the fundamental idea of the Juche-based Songun cause and its principle of independence, anti-imperialism and uninterrupted revolution is the basic principle which firmly guarantees the final victory of the revolution.
					
					The traditions and exploits established under the banner of the DIU were a priceless wherewithal for propelling the successful advance of the Korean revolution at each stage.
					
					The army and people of Korea are dynamically forging ahead along the one road for the Songun cause pioneered by the DIU, taking the revolutionary traditions established in Mt. Paektu as the eternal life-line, the only blood vessel of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: WPK Carrying Forward Great Tradition is Ever-Victorious
articles.content:
WPK Carrying Forward Great Tradition is Ever-Victorious
Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The Down-with Imperialism Union (DIU) formed by President Kim Il Sung on October 17, Juche 15 (1926) is the very root of the Workers' Party of Korea, the origin of the Songun revolution, the model of powerful single-hearted unity and the pioneer of the tradition of the Korean revolution.
					The WPK has come to display its might as the most dignified Party today through an ever-victorious leadership over the Korean revolution, unparalleled in arduousness, without a single mistake in its political lines. This is because it has invariably carried forward the glorious tradition pioneered by the DIU.
					
					In the last century the Party witnessed the grim difficulties caused by a complicated situation created by the successive collapse of the socialist ruling parties in different countries of the world and the malicious anti-DPRK moves of allied imperialist forces.
					
					But no worldwide political storm and grim test could bring the least change to the revolutionary character of the WPK.
					
					Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the WPK has upheld the cause of socialism and won victories and wrought  miracles of the century in the severe anti-U.S. confrontation and building of a great, prosperous and powerful nation, holding aloft the banner of independence, Songun and unity, the fundamental principle of the DIU.
					
					The DPRK has been able to become a dignified power of independence thanks to the independent politics of the WPK which resolves all problems in the revolution and construction in a unique way according to its faith and decision, regarding independence as its life and soul. 
					
					Under the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il, the idea of Songun and the revolutionary principle of anti-imperialism and independence put forward by the DIU have been defended up to the hilt in all the decades of the Korean revolution and incorporated comprehensively in all the activities of the Party and the State.
					
					The phenomenal consolidation of the political and ideological unity of the Party ranks, the growth of the Korean People's Army into a matchless army and gigantic changes in the revolution and construction are attributable to the Songun politics of the WPK.
					
					The tradition of unity in which the passionate fighters of the DIU held President Kim Il Sung in high esteem and shared will and life and death with him is still being unswervingly carried forward.
					
					It is the very feature of the WPK that the whole Party is overflowing with the Songun idea of Juche and the spirit of defending the leader with one's own life, maintaining ideological purity, and all its members act as one according to the intention of the leader and highly display the spirit of carrying it through at any cost.
					
					The WPK with a great tradition will always shed light as an ever-victorious party.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today dedicates a signed article to the 26th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is a Juche-Type Revolutionary Party Which Inherited the Glorious Tradition of the DIU" (Oct. 17, 1982). 
					 Kim Jong Il in the work elucidates the historic significance of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union, comprehensively deals with the precious successes and experience gained in the course of struggle for founding a Juche-type revolutionary party and strengthening and developing it and indicates tasks to be fulfilled to eternally glorify President Kim Il Sung's idea of party building and his feats performed in it and ways to do so. 
					
					 The past more than two decades since the publication of the work were significant days during which the WPK has demonstrated its dignity and might while successfully carrying forward the glorious history and tradition under the energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The WPK is making a vigorous advance under his wise leadership, holding aloft the banner of independence. It is solving all the issues arising in the party building and activities its own way on the basis of the great Juche idea and Songun idea. The Party is ushering in a new era of the country's prosperity while thoroughly preserving the Juche character and national character in all fields of the revolution and construction and regarding self-reliance as an invincible treasured sword.
					
					 Today the WPK is pervaded with the monolithic idea, the Songun idea of Juche. It has formed an invincible integral whole of its members united close around the leader in thought and purpose and in the sense of moral obligation and emerged a militant one strong in organization and discipline. This is the true picture of the WPK in the Songun era. No force on earth can break the unity and cohesion of the WPK as all its members are sharing idea and will and destiny and future with the leader in any difficulties and trials. 
					
					 The Korean people are firmly determined to make long journeys for the Songun revolution with the Party to the last, always feeling grateful to the Party which takes care of all their destiny and future. The Party and the people have formed a great harmonious whole as the former serves the latter and the latter remains true to its leadership single-mindedly. Herein lies the source of the WPK's invincible might.

articles.title: Anniversary of October Resistance for Democracy Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of October Resistance for Democracy Observed
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today dedicates a signed article to the 29th anniversary of the October resistance of youth and students and other people of south Korea for democracy. 
					 The resistance was an eruption of the pent-up grievance of the south Korean people against the ferocious "Yusin" dictatorial rule and a massive anti-imperialist, anti-fascist resistance for democracy for bringing about independent and democratic new politics and life, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The resistance was triggered off by the anti-"government" demonstration staged by students of Pusan National University on October 16, 1979.
					
					 It dealt a heavy blow to the U.S. imperialists who enforced a harsh colonial rule over south Korea after illegally occupying it and brought down the chieftain of the ill-famed "Yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 It taught a serious lesson that the south Korean people can win a decisive victory only when they put an end to the colonial rule of the U.S. imperialists and thoroughly eliminate the remnants of the pro-U.S. stooges by combining their struggle for democracy against dictatorship with the anti-U.S. struggle.
					
					 It is necessary to put an end to the U.S. imperialists' military presence in south Korea and the harsh treacherous rule of the south Korean conservative ruling forces and achieve independent reunification, peace and prosperity under the uplifted banner of national independence and unity in the idea of "By our nation itself." This is the way of realizing the cherished desire of the participants in the October resistance for democracy.
					
					 The U.S. is working hard to reinforce its colonial ruling system and revive the era of fascist dictatorship in south Korea with the help of the Lee Myung Bak regime, while driving this clique of traitors to confrontation with compatriots. As proven by the reality, it is impossible to achieve independence, democracy and reunification, the desire of the fellow countrymen in the south, unless the U.S. domination and intervention are brought to an end. Independence against the U.S. is the only way out for the south Korean people.
					
					 Traitor Lee Myung Bak is a cancer-like being standing in the way of achieving independence, democracy and reunification as he is little different from the erstwhile fascist dictators who were severely  judged by the people for perpetrating acts of treachery, backed by foreign forces. The soul of the participants in the October resistance for democracy who did not yield to dictatorship and injustice is still alive and calls on the people from all walks of life in south Korea to a just patriotic struggle to put an end to the rule of the traitorous clique.

articles.title: Japan's Desperate Efforts to Realize Its Old Dream Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Desperate Efforts to Realize Its Old Dream Blasted
Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Recently Japanese Prime Minister Aso was reported to have described the Pacific War ignited by the Japanese imperialists as the "great east Asian war" and prattled that "Japan has a glorious history, too" and the like.
					Rodong Sinmun Friday in its signed commentary carried in this connection dismisses his jargon as foolish militarist remarks intended to realize Japan's old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere," far from dropping it even in the 21st century.
					
					The war provoked by the Japanese imperialists during the period of the Second World War was a criminal war to conquer the continent in a bid to turn Asia into their colony under the motto of establishing the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere," the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					Nevertheless, the present Japanese prime minister did not hesitate to utter the words "great east Asian war". This was not a gaffe committed by him because of his ignorance of history or any misunderstanding.
					
					The reckless remark made by Aso about "glorious history" without feeling guilty conscience or shame for Japan's past aggression and defeats is nothing but outbursts that can be let loose only by those who are grinding their teeth to take revenge for its defeat in the war.
					
					The Japanese authorities are keen to realize in the present times the old dream of realizing the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" which their militarist forefathers failed to do in the past. This is an anachronistic daydream. 
					
					The Aso cabinet had better stop working hard to realize the above-said old dream which only makes its relations with its neighboring countries complicated. It would be well advised to opt for redressing Japan's past crimes, though belatedly, and drop its ridiculous militarist ambition, urges the commentary.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Moves to Grab Territory of Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Moves to Grab Tok Islet under Fire
Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the Japanese reactionaries at a Cabinet meeting asserted that Tok Islet is "part of inalienable territory of Japan".
					 Minju Joson Friday carries a signed commentary in this regard.
					
					 It says:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' claim to Tok Islet merits more serious attention as it was made at a time when the hostile moves toward the DPRK have become all the more undisguised.
					
					This proves that the Cabinet of Aso, too, still adopts it as an important state policy to isolate and stifle the DPRK and expand territory as the preceding governments did.
					
					 It is a self-evident truth that Tok Islet, part of inviolable territory of the Korean nation, can never become "territory of Japan" no matter how desperately the Japanese reactionaries assert that the islet belongs to Japan.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries make far-fetched assertion that the islet belongs to Japan although they clearly know that the islet is part of inviolable territory of the Korean nation. Lurking behind this is their sinister intention to fan up militarism and the idea of reinvasion among rising generation by imbuing them with the conception of "dominium over Tok Islet" and, at the same time, secure a pretext for aggression of Korea by sparking off territorial dispute and thus provoke wars against Korea and other Asian countries for reinvasion. 
					
					 Japan's moves to grab the islet are expression of its wild ambition to convert it into a military power and launch overseas expansion, and a prelude to reinvasion.
					
					 The DPRK is ready to meet any challenge of Japan. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to behave with discretion, clearly bearing in mind that their territorial claim will only precipitate their destruction, the commentary warns.

articles.title: One Can Hardly Deal with Anti-DPRK Confrontational Maniac
articles.content:
One Can Hardly Deal with Anti-DPRK Confrontational Maniac
Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- One can hardly deal with Ryu Jong Ha, an ill-famed anti-DPRK confrontational maniac, who was "nominated" as president of the south Korean Red Cross, holds Minju Joson Friday in a signed commentary, taking a serious view of the fact that recently traitor Lee Myung Bak replaced the present president of the Red Cross by the above-said guy.
					 It says:
					
					He was vociferous in hurling slanders and calumnies at the DPRK in a bid to isolate and stifle it, keeping himself busy touring foreign countries in the capacity of "minister of Foreign Affairs" during the rule of the  dictator in the days of "civilian government". He is a "vassal of merit" who contributed to traitor Lee's seizure of power during the "presidential election" last year.
					
					The traitor replaced the president of the Red Cross in a bid to secure a pretext to calm down the anger of the south Koreans at him, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It was Lee's calculation that if he lets Ryu propose the "resumption of the Red Cross talks", the north side will reject it and this will help the south side shift the responsibility for the deteriorated inter-Korean relations onto the north side. How brazen-faced and wicked he is. 
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that the DPRK side can hardly discuss such important issues of the nation as humanitarian matters at the negotiating table with Ryu. Who on earth would be ready to deal with an assailant? As long as such guy as Ryu remains the president of the Red Cross it is impossible for the separated families and relatives to have even a ray of hope that a reunion may take place in the future. Lee Myung Bak will be held fully accountable for this as he appointed that guy as president of the Red Cross.
					
					 Lee quite often talks about "sincerity", but nobody lends an ear to it. The action taken by Lee to let the above-said guy hold the post of the president of the Red Cross who should look after humanitarian issues, wooing the public to understand his "sincerity," only strips bare his true colors as a political swindler. Lee had better stop such folly worth a subject of caricature. He would be well advised to make apology to the nation for his sycophancy toward the U.S. and confrontation with compatriots and step down, though belatedly.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservatives' Reckless Moves under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservatives' Reckless Moves under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions issued a statement on Oct. 10 in which it denounced the conservative forces for scheming to stamp out the south Korean Teachers' Union.
					 The statement said that more than 20 wicked conservative organizations including the south Korean League of New Right and the "forum for democracy in the north" buckled down to the moves to stamp out the progressive forces after forming the "people's federation to put an end to the education against the state" on Oct. 9 soon after Lee Myung Bak cried that the leftist forces are causing the contradiction of ideas.
					
					 It pointed out that such reckless moves of the conservative forces are aimed at preventing the union from conducting just and objective educational activities, and infusing the idea against democracy and reunification into the students.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak's undemocratic dictatorial regime and the sycophantic conservative forces should not act rashly, clearly facing up to the trend of the times, it added.
					
					 The union in its statement released on Oct. 9 disclosed that the reckless moves committed by the conservative forces while claiming that the union should be disbanded as it violates law and order are closely linked with the Lee regime's moves for reviving the past dictatorial era.
					
					 It is foolish for those who are marginalized in the society to try to turn back the clock of the history, the statement warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Police Suppression Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Police Suppression Protested
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities' despicable suppression of the participants in the candlelight actions against American beef import is getting all the more pronounced these days.
					 The puppet police authorities suppressed more than 20 members of the "federation of truck drivers for candlelight action", an Internet organization, on September 30 on charges of "criminal use of trucks." In this connection, the federation called a press conference in Seoul on October 13 to protest against the unreasonable suppression by the police.
					
					 Speakers at the press conference said that the members of the organization failed to participate in the candlelight action at that time due to the public security forces' obstruction, but the police went so despicable as to present the photos of the trucks in the parking lot they had taken as "evidences."
					
					 The police went the lengths of threatening the members of the organization while investigating even their families, the speakers noted.
					
					 A press release was read out then. It noted that the police are now running amuck to take the measure for "canceling driving license." This is part of the merciless retaliation against the candlelight actions, it said, declaring that they would take legal counteractions in protest against the measure.
					
					 Meanwhile, opposition parties including the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea, too, denounced the police, asserting that it was the mean act to deprive the citizens of their rights to existence to check the candlelight struggle.

articles.title: S. Korean Bellicose Forces' Moves to Retrogressively Revise Anti-DPRK War Scenario Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Bellicose Forces' Moves to Retrogressively Revise Anti-DPRK War Scenario Assailed
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The puppet bellicose forces of south Korea are now busy retrogressively revising the "OPLAN 5027-04," a scenario for a war against the north, as a whole, loudly talking about "threat" from someone, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					 It is said that the puppet Metropolitan Garrison Command at an "inspection of administration" of the "National Defense Committee of National Assembly" on October 13 declared that it would reflect 24 tasks for "coping with provocation" by someone and the way of making use of firepower in the center of city, etc. in the "OPLAN 5027-04."
					
					 It is also said that the puppet Special Warfare Command, too, is revising the operation plan in such a way as to ensure the correct analysis of the attempt of "enemy" in order to carry out duties including intrusion into the "enemy" region, spying and watching and striking at major facilities, and heighten its effect.
					
					 This shows that the operation plan is being supplemented and completed in the direction of rendering support to the navy and air forces so that they may strike at "enemy's" facilities in tweezers-like way, the news reported.
					
					 The puppet military warmongers are getting frantic in arms buildup for aggression with the backing of the U.S. while more elaborating the war scenario and giving spurs to the preparations for the invasion of the north.

articles.title: Japan's Measure for Extension of "Sanctions" against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Measure for Extension of "Sanctions" against DPRK under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), called a press conference at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on October 10 and released a statement denouncing the Japanese authorities' another extension of "sanctions" against the DPRK.
					 The statement referred to the unwarranted decision to extend "sanctions" against the DPRK for six months made by the Japanese government at a meeting of cabinet ministers on October 10.
					
					 Everyone knows that the "sanctions" only deteriorate the DPRK-Japan confrontation and bilateral relations, the statement noted, and went on:
					
					 The Japanese authorities' politically-motivated suppression of Chongryon and human rights abuses against Koreans in Japan under the cloak of "sanctions" are unpardonable fascist violence.
					
					 We once again demand the Japanese government immediately repeal the unwarranted "sanctions" going against the world public opinion and the trend of the times and take sincere approach to the issues of settling the past and normalizing the DPRK-Japan relations in the spirit of the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration.
					
					 In particular, we strongly demand the Japanese authorities stop the politically-motivated suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and human rights abuses against them and lift embargo on the ship "Mangyongbong-92" and regulation banning reentry into Japan of all Koreans in Japan at once.

articles.title: 63rd Anniversary of WPK Celebrated in Indonesia
articles.content:
63rd Anniversary of WPK Celebrated in Indonesia
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks, a lecture and a briefing took place in Indonesia from October 6 to 9 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 Speeches were made by several figures there.
					
					 The acting general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Vanguard Party of Indonesia said that the WPK could have carried forward the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung without an inch of deviation as it was led by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed belief that the WPK would always emerge victorious in its struggle for building a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country as long as it is led by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The director of a company of Indonesia noted that the WPK is an organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people, which led the socialist cause along the road of victory for a long period of history.

articles.title: Proposal for DFRK Supported
articles.content:
Proposal for DFRK Supported
 Pyongyang, October 17 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain made public a statement on Oct. 3 on the occasion of the 28th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK). 
					 The statement noted that the said proposal set forth by President Kim Il Sung is the only and realistic one for the reunification of the Korean Peninsula where the Korean nation of the same blood and culture have lived separated for a long time under different systems with different ideas.
					
					 If the proposal is realized, the Korean people will be able to make free visits, the separated families reunite again and Korea would develop into a great independent power, the statement said, and went on: 
					
					 Lee Myung Bak acting as a flunkey of the U.S. without independence is bound to meet destruction along with Bush and capitalism. 
					
					 Now is the time to completely wipe out the U.S. imperialists and all their lackeys and intensify the struggle for Korea's reunification, the statement stressed, calling for waging a dynamic struggle to found the DFRK.

articles.title: ACR de RPDC denuncia crimenes antinacionales de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
ACR de RPDC denuncia crimenes antinacionales de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 17 de octubre (ATCC) -- Ultimamente, la banda de Lee Myung Bak sustituyo al presidente de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja (SCR) del Sur de Corea antes de finalizado su mandato so pretexto de la liquidacion de los residuos del "gobierno izquierdista pro-norteno".
					El portavoz del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja (ACR) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publico el dia 16 una declaracion al respecto calificando esa chapuceria  de imperdonable acto antinacional y crimen anti-reunificacion que contraviene a la aspiracion de toda la nacion coreana a la reconciliacion y la unidad nacionales y al espiritu fundamental de la Cruz Roja que profesa el humanitarismo y el neutralismo.
					
					El nuevo presidente de la SCR del Sur de Corea Ryu Jong Ha es un elemento conservador ultraderechista, que tomo parte activa en la elaboracion de la "politica al Norte" de caracter antinacional en contubernio con el actual "poder" conservador proyanqui y suele decir palabras que incitan la confrontacion fratricida, revela la nota y continua:
					
					Al nombrar ayer en los importantes puestos del poder a los elementos proyanquis anti-reunificacion e involucrar hoy en los trabajos humanitarios a ese tipejo acostumbrado a desconfiar y tratar con hostilidad al coterraneo Norte, el traidor Lee Myung Bak revelo una vez mas su intencion de rehusar hasta el final la implementacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre y perseguir unicamente la politica de confrontacion con la RPDC y en contra de reunificacion.
					
					Mientras ese lacayo al servicio de las maniobras conflictivas con la RPDC de la banda de Lee este ocupando ese cargo importante de la SCR del Sur de Corea, resulta obvio que no se puede esperar las labores de la Cruz Roja entre el Norte y el Sur ni discutir nada en cuanto a los problemas humanitarios.
					
					La responsabilidad de todas las consecuencias, que emanen en lo delante de las labores de la Cruz Roja Norte-Sur, recaera enteradamente sobre los compinches de Lee.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre los cancilleres de Corea y Rusia
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre los cancilleres de Corea y Rusia
Pyongyang, 17 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 15 en Moscu las conversaciones entre el canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Pak Ui Chun de visita en Rusia y el canciller de la Federacion Rusa Serguei Lavrov.
					En la ocasion participaron por parte coreana la comitiva del canciller y el embajador coreano en Rusia Kim Yong Jae y por la rusa, el vicecanciller Alexey Borodapkin y otros  funcionarios.
					
					En las conversaciones ambas partes se refirieron a que se celebro significativamente el 60 aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre Corea y Rusia e intercambiaron opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y una serie de problemas internacionales de interes mutuo.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Rubricado plan de intercambio entre cancillerias de Corea y Rusia
articles.content:
Rubricado plan de intercambio entre cancillerias de Corea y Rusia
Pyongyang, 17 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo suscrito el dia 15 en Moscu el plan de intercambio para 2009-2010 entre los Ministerios de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana, el canciller Pak Ui Chun y su comitiva, de visita en Rusia y el embajador coreano en este pais Kim Yong Jae, y por la rusa, el canciller Serguei Lavrov, el vicecanciller Alexei Borodapkin y otros funcionarios.
					
					Los cancilleres de ambos paises firmaron el documento.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta disparate de Aso
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta disparate de Aso
Pyongyang, 17 de octubre (ATCC) -- El primer ministro japones Aso describio recientemente la Guerra del Pacifico provocada por los imperialistas japoneses como la "guerra de gran Asia oriental" y dijo que "Japon tiene tambien la historia orgullosa".
					Este disparate parte de su ambicion militarista de realizar a toda costa en el siglo 21 el destenido sueno de establecer la "esfera de coprosperidad de gran Asia oriental".
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 17 y continua: 
					
					Las criminales guerras provocadas por los imperialistas japoneses durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial tuvieron por su objetivo la conquista del continente asiatico para convertirlo en su colonia bajo el rotulo de "Esfera de coprosperidad de gran Asia oriental".
					
					El uso de la expresion "guerra de gran Asia oriental" por el premier japones Aso no se trata de un simple error proveniente de la ignorancia de la historia o de alguna equivocacion.
					
					Hablar de la supuesta "historia orgullosa" sin sentirse culpable o avergonzado de sus crimenes del pasado cometidos al agredir a otros paises y de la consiguiente derrota resulta el disparate que se les puede ocurrir solo a los que rechinan los dientes por reparar la derrota y tomar la "venganza".
					
					En vez de complicar las relaciones con los paises vecinos tratando anacronicamente de realizar el equivocado sueno de los antecesores militaristas con la "Esfera de coprosperidad de gran Asia oriental", el gabinete de Aso debe ponerse, aunque ya es tarde, a la liquidacion del pasado criminal y liberarse de esta ilusion militarista.
